document_data.name: Fringe Philosophy
document_data.author: ''Various''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Fringe Philosophy''''' was a compendium of magic theories that were deemed too unconventional for mainstream publication. Numeroues personalities from across the Realms contributed entries to its numerous volumes.

Content.Volume V: One entry in the 5{{th}} volume of ''Fringe Philosophies'' was attributed to the [[Gond]]ar High Artificer [[Thaura Brinn]] of [[Baldur's Gate]]. Brinn postulated that the [[earthmote]]s of the Realms were created from residual magic associated with the [[Netherese enclave|enclaves]] of ancient [[Netheril]]. She argued that despite Netheril's ties with the dark goddess Shar, their legacy of flying cities still deserved to be studied, regardless of the consequences.

document_data.History: As of the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, a copy of this book could be found in the library of the [[Emerald Grove]] on the [[Sword Coast]].
